settingsPane.description: These settings control CFS (Complete Fair Scheduler) Task Scheduler Settings
settingsPane.name: CFS Settings

checkbox.description: Disabling GENTLE_FAIR_SLEEPERS may give you better UI responsiveness.
checkbox.name: GENTLE_FAIR_SLEEPERS
checkbox.label: GENTLE_FAIR_SLEEPERS

spinner.description: Sets the CPU Idle Mode. AFTR+LPA is the default and best for the battery life but if you have problems try Idle+LPA.
spinner.name: CPU Idle Mode

spinner.description: Sets the smooth scaling level which prevents ondemand based governors to jump directly to maximum frequency with load spikes. This setting will only change the behavior of ondemand and pegasusq governors.
spinner.name: Smooth Scaling Level

spinner.description: Sets the number of CPUs to be used in hotplugging (only for PegasusQ)
spinner.name: Max CPU Lock

spinner.description: Sets the CPU undervolting value which will be applied during boot time only. It will not have any effect until you restart your device. Remember: if you change this value and your device doesn't boot you will have to reset extweaks settings using CWM recovery. This value will be applied to all CPU steps before any script or app execution. If you use any script or voltage control app this setting may be overriden by those.
spinner.name: CPU Undervolting

spinner.description: This will set the default CPU governor. Default CPU governor will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution) and can be overriden by later scripts or apps.
spinner.name: Default CPU Governor

seekBar.description: Scaling maximum frequency (Samsung default: 1200000)
seekBar.name: scaling_max_freq

seekBar.description: Scaling minimum frequency (Samsung default: 200000)
seekBar.name: scaling_min_freq

settingsPane.description: GPU Frequency Settings. Defaults frequencies are 100, 133, 160, 200 and 267. Voltage defaults are 900mV, 950mV, 1000mV and 1050mV.
settingsPane.name: GPUFreq

checkbox.description: Enabling VPLL mode may be unstable on some devices so do not complain if your device crash or burn. If you do not use VPLL Mode some frequency steps will be unavailable.
checkbox.name: VPLL Mode
checkbox.label: VPLL Mode

spinner.description: Changes the first GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step1

spinner.description: Changes the second GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step2

spinner.description: Changes the third GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step3

spinner.description: Changes the fourth GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step4

spinner.description: Changes the fifth GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step5

settingsPane.description: GPU Voltage Levels: The defaults are 900, 950, 950, 1000 and 1050.
settingsPane.name: GPU Voltage Levels

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the first step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level1

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the second step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level2

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the third step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level3

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the fourth step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level4

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the fifth step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level5

settingsPane.description: GPU load thresholds to change between frequency steps.
settingsPane.name: GPU Thresholds

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from first to second step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 1-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from second to first step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 2-DOWN

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from second to third step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 2-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from third to second step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 3-DOWN

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from third to fourth step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 3-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from fourth to third step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 4-DOWN

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from fourth to fifth step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 4-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from fifth to fourth step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 5-DOWN

seekBar.description: Headphone Amplifier Level (0-3 which corresponds to 0-1.5-3-6dB)
seekBar.name: Headphone Amplifier

seekBar.description: Headphone Amplification Level
seekBar.name: Analog Headphone

seekBar.description: Microphone Amplifier Level (Used to increase or decrease volume during calls)
seekBar.name: Microphone Amplifier

seekBar.description: Speaker Amplifier Level (Used in playing videos, calls with speakerphone, and so on)
seekBar.name: Speaker Amplifier

settingsPane.description: Brightness Curve settings which modify auto-brightness behavior.
settingsPane.name: Brightness Curve

seekBar.description: Sets touchscreen move sensitivity (vitalij value).
seekBar.name: TouchMove Sensitivity

seekBar.description: Setting min_bl higher will result in staying lowest brightness level for brighter conditions (default 30)
seekBar.name: min_bl

seekBar.description: Minimum brightness level (default 0)
seekBar.name: min_gamma

seekBar.description: Maximum brightness level (default 24)
seekBar.name: max_gamma

seekBar.description: User adjustable gamma shift.
seekBar.name: Gamma Shift

checkbox.description: Enable slide2wake feature. Enabling this feature may decrease your battery life.
checkbox.name: Slide2Wake
checkbox.label: Slide2Wake

checkbox.description: mDNIe sharpness tweaks from hardcore. Requires reboot to be effective.
checkbox.name: mDNIe Sharpness Tweaks
checkbox.label: mDNIe Sharpness Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable inverting the screen colors by quickly pressing Home button 4 times
checkbox.name: mDNIe Negative Toggle
checkbox.label: mDNIe Negative Toggle

seekBar.description: FB earlysuspend delay to run CRT animation when you turn the screen off.
seekBar.name: FB Earlysuspend Delay

spinner.description: This setting will set led behavior in BLN.
spinner.name: BLN Effect

spinner.description: Led timeout. Select 'Use ROM defaults' if your ROM already has led timeout support (requires restart). You will need to use this setting on Samsung ROMs if you want to use led fadeout effect.
spinner.name: led_timeout

checkbox.description: BLN Without Wakelock. You cannot use blinking or breathing effects together with this option. Enabling this will let the CPU sleep during BLN and save battery.
checkbox.name: BLNWW
checkbox.label: BLNWW

checkbox.description: Led fadeout effect. If you are on a Samsung ROM, you need to set touchkey leds to always on or always off and use led timeout in ExTweaks.
checkbox.name: led-fadeout
checkbox.label: led-fadeout

checkbox.description: Selecting this will activate turning touckey leds on when you touch the screen (only when led timeout is enabled).
checkbox.name: Leds on with touch
checkbox.label: led-on-touch

button.description: Use this button to test bln. BLN will be active after you turn the screen off.
button.name: Test BLN
button.label: Test BLN

seekBar.description: Controls touchpad led voltage level (default: 3000)
seekBar.name: Led Voltage Level

checkbox.description: Automatic touchpad led voltage level. If this one is checked touchpad led voltage level will be ignored.
checkbox.name: Auto Led Voltage
checkbox.label: Auto Led Voltage

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Android Logger (needs reboot)
checkbox.name: Android Logger
checkbox.label: Android Logger

spinner.description: This will set the default I/O scheduler. Default I/O scheduler will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution) and can be overriden by later scripts or apps.
spinner.name: Default I/O Scheduler

spinner.description: Change USB connection mode. Either leave it as default or force it to mass storage mode (you will see your sdcards as disks) or mtp
spinner.name: USB Mass Storage Mode

checkbox.description: If checked, BetterBatteryStatus will report discrete (non-overlapping) wakelock statistics.
checkbox.name: Discrete Wakelock Stats
checkbox.label: Discrete Wakelock Stats

button.description: If you think that the fuel gauge chip is behaving weird use this button to reset it. Give it a few hours after you reset the gauge. It may still show you funny values for those period, then the battery percentage should be fine.
button.name: Reset Fuel-Gauge Chip
button.label: Reset Fuel-Gauge Chip

settingsPane.description: Removing/Reinstalling root to support some apps which requires you not to have a rooted phone.
settingsPane.name: Remove/Reinstall Root

button.description: Removes su and Superuser.apk files from the system partition
button.name: Remove Root
button.label: Remove Root

checkbox.description: If checked, installs root on the next reboot.
checkbox.name: Auto-Install Root
checkbox.label: Auto-Install Root

settingsPane.description: Dual-Boot Settings. Warning: No confirmation will be asked for reboot buttons.
settingsPane.name: Dual-Boot Settings

button.description: Reboot into custom recovery which let you configure, clone or backup the 2ndROM
button.name: Reboot into Recovery
button.label: Reboot into 2ndROM Utils

checkbox.description: Check this if you don't want boot logo to be shown. If this options is checked boot logo will not be shown even if you have 2ndROM installed.
checkbox.name: No boot-logo
checkbox.label: No boot-logo

spinner.description: Default ROM to boot into. If you don't have 2ndROM installation 1stROM will be booted. If you press the home or volume-down buttons during the boot logo the alternative ROM will be booted, i.e. 1stROM will be booted if the default ROM selection is the 2ndROM.
spinner.name: Default ROM
